steps.description: Customer browses catalogue or search, views product detail pages (e.g., TESCO_1L_MILK, TESCO_500G_PASTA), applies Clubcard offers, and adds items to basket. Business event: cart_created and line_item_added events emitted with SKU, price, discount and quantity.
steps.businessRationale: Typical browsing and selection for a weekly grocery shop takes several minutes; faster basket creation increases conversion and AOV by enabling more items to be added before slot selection.

steps.description: Customer selects delivery or click-and-collect slot; availability and pricing (delivery fee) are validated. Business event: slot_selected with slot_id, fee, and fulfilment_center attributes.
steps.businessRationale: Slot selection is a short, high-impact step; inability to find a slot or slow availability checks cause immediate abandonment and lost revenue.

steps.description: Customer reviews basket, applies vouchers, chooses payment method, and confirms order. Business events: checkout_started, discount_applied, checkout_completed (pre-payment) with order_summary and estimated_revenue.
steps.businessRationale: Checkout UX must be streamlined; each extra minute or friction reduces conversion. This step converts intent to a payable order and is directly tied to revenue capture.

steps.description: Payment gateway interaction, fraud checks, and payment confirmation. Business events: payment_attempted, payment_succeeded, payment_failed with payment_provider, auth_code, and revenue recorded.
steps.businessRationale: Payment latency must be minimal; failures or declines cause immediate revenue loss and increase churn. This step finalizes the transaction amount that will be attributed to the order.

steps.description: Order is routed to fulfilment centre, items are picked and packed. If items are out of stock, substitution logic triggers: auto-substitute, customer approval, or refund. Business events: order_dispatched, substitution_offered, substitution_accepted, substitution_rejected, item_refunded.
steps.businessRationale: Fulfilment lead time includes picking and packing; substitutions handling affects customer satisfaction and retention. Duration reflects time until dispatch and includes human/warehouse processing windows.

steps.description: Last-mile delivery or customer collection, delivery confirmation, and post-order follow-up (feedback request, refunds if needed). Business events: out_for_delivery, delivered, collection_checked_in, delivery_failed, refund_issued, feedback_submitted.
steps.businessRationale: Delivery window spans hours; real-time tracking and confirmation are critical for SLA compliance and retention. Post-order follow-up drives NPS and repeat purchase behavior.
